definition: to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

sentences.english: It tur out that you are Mr. Ford's son. No wonder you are the very image of him.
sentences.chinese: 原来你是福特先生的公子，怪不得长得那么象他。

sentences.english: No wonder the banana is the number one fruit with the world\\\'s leading athletes.
sentences.chinese: 怪不得香蕉能够成为世界顶级运动员的首选水果。

sentences.english: No wonder parents agonise over what names to give their babies.
sentences.chinese: 怪不得父母们为给宝宝们取什么名字而苦苦思索。

sentences.english: It turns out that you are Mr. David's son. No wonder you are the very image of him.
sentences.chinese: 原来你是大卫先生的公子，怪不得长得那么象他。

sentences.english: It seems that cash should not be treated in that way since our disdain has nothing to do with money.
sentences.chinese: 既然看不上，与金钱无缘，好像也怪不得铜钱了。

sentences.english: No wonder Chen Damei says "there would not be me without Mr. Tang".
sentences.chinese: 怪不得陈大妹要说“莫得唐大爷就莫得我噻”这句话。

sentences.english: No wonder they had something in common.
sentences.chinese: 也怪不得他们会有一点点”志同道合“。

sentences.english: May be she is the stunner of the world.
sentences.chinese: 怪不得她被评为世界上最性感的女人呢。

sentences.english: No wonder the Red Flag Canal is called the Great Water Wall of China.
sentences.chinese: 怪不得红旗渠被称为中国的水长城啊。

sentences.english: I am no longer surprised at your knowing only six accomplished women.
sentences.chinese: 怪不得你只认识六个才女啦。

sentences.english: No surprise that emperor Cha Jie so of fret oneself.
sentences.chinese: 怪不得帝刹桀那样的担心自己。

sentences.english: It's no wonder that quality sleep is sometimes elusive.
sentences.chinese: 因此怪不得高质量的睡眠有时候很难以理解的。

sentences.english: No wonder you're so experienced you have worked here for ten years.
sentences.chinese: 怪不得你这么有经蚜宫你在这里已经工作10年了。

sentences.english: You wonder why the ocean is so salty…
sentences.chinese: 丫丫的，怪不得海水这么咸了。

sentences.english: Small wonder that Britain's market for ready-made convenience foods has doubled in the last five years.
sentences.chinese: 怪不得英国市场的便利熟食在过去五年里增长了一倍。

sentences.english: Japan work culture for you - no wonder there's a shortage of talent.
sentences.chinese: 这就是日本的工作文化，怪不得这里人才缺失呢。

definition: really/as expected/sure enough/if indeed.../if it's really...
to be worthy of/to deserve to be called/to prove oneself to be
if it were not for/but for
can it be possible that/could it be
unexpected/hard to imagine/it had not occurred to me/who could have thought that
don't tell me .../could it be that...?
unexpectedly/to one's surprise/go so far as to
hey!/(interjection used to attract attention or to express surprise or disapprobation)
